verses.text: Do not fret because of evil men or be envious of those who do wrong;

rsbNotes.title: Ps 37
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 37 An acrostic (Introduction: Characteristics and Themes), and like most acrostics, a wisdom meditation.

verses.text: for like the grass they will soon wither, like green plants they will soon die away.
Trust in the LORD and do good; dwell in the land and enjoy safe pasture.
Delight yourself in the LORD and he will give you the desires of your heart.
Commit your way to the LORD; trust in him and he will do this:
He will make your righteousness shine like the dawn, the justice of your cause like the noonday sun.
Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him; do not fret when men succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 37:2
rsbNotes.text: 37:2 grass. The metaphor is apt. In Israel the grass comes up and flourishes in the winter, but in the summer is withered by the sun.

verses.text: Refrain from anger and turn from wrath; do not fret-it leads only to evil.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 37:8
rsbNotes.text:
37:8 anger. Probably anger against God.

tends only to evil. Anger is a dangerous force (James 1:20).

verses.text: For evil men will be cut off, but those who hope in the LORD will inherit the land.
A little while, and the wicked will be no more; though you look for them, they will not be found.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 37:9
rsbNotes.text: 37:9 cut off. A technical term meaning to be exiled, to be excommunicated from society, or even to be executed (Gen. 17:14; Lev. 17:14).

verses.text: But the meek will inherit the land and enjoy great peace.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 37:11
rsbNotes.text: 37:11 the meek shall inherit the land. Land and its cultivation is the basis of physical life. This verse is used in Matt. 5:5.
